objective: Understand the family structure and the management of resources.
content: Family types, life cycles, and values. Management of time, money, and energy.
specific_objectives: Differentiate between various family types in the Caribbean
Identify the stages of the family life cycle
Discuss the roles and responsibilities of family members
Explain the management process: Planning, Organizing, Implementing, Evaluating
Apply budgeting and consumer education principles to household management

objective: Apply nutritional principles to meal planning and preparation.
content: Nutrients, balanced diets, special nutritional needs, and food preservation.
specific_objectives: List the major nutrients (carbohydrates, proteins, fats, vitamins, minerals) and their functions
Explain the concept of 'Food Groups' and a balanced diet
Plan meals for different individuals (infants, adolescents, elderly, athletes)
Describe various methods of cooking and their effects on nutrients
Discuss food safety, hygiene, and preservation techniques

objective: Understand the properties of textiles and the basics of clothing design.
content: Fiber classification, fabric construction, garment assembly, and fashion trends.
specific_objectives: Classify natural and man-made fibers and their properties
Identify methods of fabric construction (weaving, knitting, non-woven)
Explain the use and care of a sewing machine and other tools
Describe steps in garment construction (patterns, cutting, seams, finishes)
Analyze factors influencing fashion trends and wardrobe planning

objective: Evaluate housing needs and the selection of home furnishings.
content: Housing types, safety in the home, interior design principles, and equipment maintenance.
specific_objectives: Identify factors influencing the choice of housing
Apply interior design principles (color, texture, balance) to the home
Discuss safety and sanitation in the home and kitchen
Select and maintain household equipment and appliances
Evaluate the impact of housing on the environment
